topic.title: Pulse Width Modulator

body.p:
PMCSJIRAJIRA-Q8530-429
MRPC Command ID: 0x03

The Pulse Width Modulator Command provides control of the on-chip Pulse Width Modulator (PWM), which supports the control of up to 8 fans, with an output frequency ranging from 5 Hz to 300 kHz. It has two sub-commands, Get Configuration and Set Configuration, which allows users to control fan operation, frequency, and/or duty cycle.

table.title: Pulse Width Modulator Command Return Values

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: Pulse Width Modulator - Get Configuration Sub-Command

body.p: The Get Configuration sub-command is used to read the configuration of the fan operation, frequency, and duty cycle of a PWM channel.

table.title: Pulse Width Modulator Command Get Configuration Input Data

body.p: Specifies the Pulse Width Modulator Sub-Command. Set to 0x0 for the Get Configuration operation.
This field specifies the Pulse Width Modulation bus to query. Valid range is 0 - 7.

table.title: Pulse Width Modulator Command Get Configuration Output Data

body.p: Specifies the Pulse Width Modulator Sub-Command. Set to 0x0 for the Get Configuration operation.
This field specifies the Pulse Width Modulation bus to query. Valid range is 0 - 7.
This field specifies the spin-up time of the fan:
0 - 0 ms
When the fan starts from a stationary state, the PWM output is held at 100% duty-cycle during spin-up time.
This field specifies the spin-up control options of the fan:
0 - Normal Operation (default)
1 - Terminate Spin-Up
2 - Spin-Up Override
This field indicates if the duty-cycle is inverted on the channel's output:
0 - The duty cycle defines the on time
1 - The duty cycle defines the off time
This field indicates if this channel is enabled or disabled:
0 - Disabled
1 - Enabled
This field indicates the output frequency of the channel, where the output frequency = (System Clock)/Pre-Scale. The System Clock is 300 MHz.

This field indicates the number of system clock cycles for which the channel's output is high in one channel period. The System Clock is 300 MHz, and the channel period is determined by the Pre-Scale value.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: Pulse Width Modulator - Set Configuration Sub-Command

body.p: The Set Configuration sub-command is used to write the configuration of the fan operation, frequency, and duty cycle of a PWM channel.

table.title: Pulse Width Modulator Command Set Configuration Input Data

body.p: Specifies the Pulse Width Modulator Sub-Command. Set to 0x1 for the Set Configuration operation.
This field specifies the PWM channel to query. Valid range is 0 - 7.
This field specifies the spin-up time of the fan:
0 - 0 ms
When the fan starts from a stationary state, the PWM output is held at 100% duty-cycle during spin-up time.
This field specifies the spin-up control options of the fan:
0 - Normal Operation (default)
1 - Terminate Spin-Up
2 - Spin-Up Override
This field indicates if the duty-cycle is inverted on the channel's output:
0 - The duty cycle defines the on time
1 - The duty cycle defines the off time
This field indicates if this channel is enabled or disabled:
0 - Disabled
1 - Enabled
This field indicates the output frequency of the channel, where the output frequency = (System Clock)/Pre-Scale. The System Clock is 300 MHz.

This field indicates the number of system clock cycles for which the channel's output is high in one channel period. The System Clock is 300 MHz, and the channel period is determined by the Pre-Scale value.
There is no output data for this sub-command.
